author: Nancy Dillon
title: Alaska Airlines pilot allegedly drugged and raped by co-pilot who is still employed
description: An Alaska Airlines pilot filed a lawsuit Wednesday claiming she was drugged and raped last year by a co-pilot who remains on the job.

author: Arjun Kharpal
title: Over $60 billion wiped off value of cryptocurrencies in 24 hours as bitcoin slide continues
description: Increased regulatory scrutiny, Google banning cryptocurrency-related ads, and continued bitcoin selling by the trustee of Mt.Gox, was behind the fall in cryptocurrency prices.

author: Saabira Chaudhuri
title: Unilever Picks Rotterdam Over London for Headquarters
description: Unilever has decided to consolidate its dual headquarters in Rotterdam over London, in an emotionally charged move that came despite last-minute lobbying from the British government.

author: Billboard.com
title: iHeartMedia's Chapter 11 Filing: What Happens Next for the Radio Giant
description: iHeartMedia and some of its subsidiaries filed for Chapter 11 protection last night after reaching a pre-packaged agreement with its principle creditors that will apparently see the company cut its debt in half to $10 billion.
